results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Censorship;Quarantines;Xi Jinping;Communist Party of China;Chengdu (China);China;Daqing (China);Hainan Island (China);Shanghai (China);Shenzhen (China);Sichuan Province (China)
results.title: As China Imposes More Covid Lockdowns, ‘Everyone Is Scared’
results.abstract: Nearly every province has recorded infections in recent days, leaving some 60 million residents locked down. Weariness is growing by the day as the restrictions go on seemingly without end.

media.caption: A testing site in Chengdu, China, on Friday, during a lockdown. The city’s testing system collapsed over the weekend, leaving residents waiting in line for hours.

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Decisions and Verdicts;Child Pornography;Pop and Rock Music;Elden, Spencer;Cobain, Kurt;Nirvana (Music Group)
results.title: Judge Dismisses Suit Over Naked Baby Image on Nirvana Album Cover
results.abstract: Spencer Elden, who was pictured as a baby on the cover of “Nevermind,” argued in his lawsuit that the grunge rock group had engaged in “child pornography.”

media.caption: Spencer Elden says he has grown increasingly uncomfortable with how he came to be on the cover of “Nevermind.” This picture was taken at the same pool in 2016, when Mr. Elden and the record were both 25.

results.adx_keywords: Referendums;Constitutions;Voting and Voters;Abortion;Human Rights and Human Rights Violations;Boric, Gabriel;Chile
results.title: Chile Says ‘No’ to Left-Leaning Constitution After 3 Years of Debate
results.abstract: The rejected constitution would have legalized abortion, adopted universal health care and enshrined more than 100 constitutional rights, a global record.
des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

results.title: A Second Constitutional Convention? Some Republicans Want to Force One
results.abstract: A new book by a former Democratic senator warns of the risks of allowing states to call for a convention. Some in the G.O.P. see it as the only way to rein in the federal government.

media.caption: Conservative Republicans in Congress are seeking to clear a path for a constitutional convention.

results.title: California Governor Signs Bill to Regulate Fast-Food Industry
results.abstract: The measure will create a state council to establish minimum pay and regulate safety conditions on an industrywide basis.

media.caption: Gov. Gavin Newsom signed a bill to set up a 10-member council to oversee the fast-food industry’s labor practices.

results.title: Venice: Brendan Fraser Mounts a Transformational Comeback
results.abstract: In Darren Aronofsky’s “The Whale,” the onetime leading hunk is earning Oscar chatter for his role as a 600-pound recluse, though the emotional actor is wary.

media.caption: Brendan Fraser arriving at the Excelsior Hotel pier on Sunday in Venice.

results.title: For Mark Spitz, Olympic Greatness Came Amid Tragedy
results.abstract: The former swimmer said it was “like an out-of-body experience” to win seven gold medals at the 1972 Munich Games and then learn that terrorists had attacked Israelis at the Olympic Village.

media.copyright: Hana Asano for The New York Times

results.byline: By Mark Landler and Stephen Castle
results.title: Liz Truss to Replace Boris Johnson at a Time of Crisis for Britain
results.abstract: Ms. Truss, who prevailed over Rishi Sunak, will be greeted by an array of vexing problems, including double-digit inflation, a looming recession, labor unrest and soaring household energy bills.

media.caption: Liz Truss at the Conservative Party headquarters in London on Monday after it was announced that she had prevailed in the contest to be Britain's next prime minister.

results.title: Judge Grants Trump’s Request for Special Master to Review Mar-a-Lago Documents
results.abstract: The ruling also effectively barred federal prosecutors from using key pieces of evidence as they continue to investigate whether Mr. Trump illegally retained national defense documents at his estate.

media.caption: A federal judge said that a special master could evaluate the documents seized from former President Donald J. Trump’s estate.

results.title: Northwest Georgia Hit by Severe Storms and Flash Flooding
results.abstract: An estimated 12 inches of rain fell in Chattooga and Floyd Counties, where the governor declared a state of emergency. A flood watch was discontinued Monday evening.

results.title: Javier Zamora Carried a Heavy Load. He Laid it to Rest on the Page.
results.abstract: Decades after traveling without his parents from El Salvador to the U.S. as a 9-year-old — a journey that almost killed him — Zamora describes the experience in a memoir.

media.caption: “I don’t expect the people who are in the book to read it. But my dream scenario is that they open it,” Zamora said, “and see that there is this book out there thanking them.”

results.abstract: For their latest big-screen partnership, they play exes who take shots at each other. It’s not such a stretch to the fond insults they sling in real life.

results.abstract: Behind every new New York season are a lot of wannabes, also-rans and hopeless cases to keep track of.

results.title: With Voters From Both Parties Energized, Campaigns Begin Fall Sprint
results.abstract: Republicans are focusing on pocketbook issues, and Democrats are emphasizing abortion rights, as Labor Day marks the start of the midterm elections’ final stretch.
